page.title: 05The Manor House
page.content: In 1086{William the Conqueror gave {the Manor to Walter }Giffard, Earl of Buckingham. The Lord lived in a castle which was built on Church Hill. The Manor House was used by the church until the {Reformation.}The Prebend or Priest lived in the house. The house was brought by the{Duke of Buckingham. Nowdays the Lester family own the house. One of the last Prebends was William Smythe (1507-1528). He had the famous{twisted chimney }built which is twisted on the{inside}and the outside. Pebendary John Rudyng installed fire places in the Manor House in the 15 century. As the house is so big it has been made into {two houses. { }On the front of the Manor House is a picture of a{cherub,}some people think it may be a symbol of St. Rumwold.
